From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin perforāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [pər.fuˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [pər.foˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [peɾ.foˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Homophone: perforà
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

perforar (first-person singular present perforo, first-person singular preterite perforí, past participle perforat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. (transitive) to bore, perforate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of perforar (first conjugation)
infinitive perforar
gerund perforant
past participle masculine feminine
singular perforat perforada
plural perforats perforades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present perforo perfores perfora perforem perforeu perforen
imperfect perforava perforaves perforava perforàvem perforàveu perforaven
future perforaré perforaràs perforarà perforarem perforareu perforaran
preterite perforí perforares perforà perforàrem perforàreu perforaren
conditional perforaria perforaries perforaria perforaríem perforaríeu perforarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present perfori perforis perfori perforem perforeu perforin
imperfect perforés perforessis perforés perforéssim perforéssiu perforessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — perfora perfori perforem perforeu perforin
negative (no) — no perforis no perfori no perforem no perforeu no perforin

Related terms

[edit]
  • perforació

Further reading

[edit]
  • “perforar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “perforar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “perforar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “perforar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin perforāre.

Verb

[edit]

perforar (first-person singular present perforo, first-person singular preterite perforei, past participle perforado)

  1. to perforate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of perforar
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person

Preterite perforei perforaches perforou perforamos perforastes perforaron
Pluperfect perforara perforaras perforara perforaramos perforarades perforaran
Future perforarei perforarás perforará perforaremos perforaredes perforarán
Conditional perforaría perforarías perforaría perforariamos perforariades perforarían

Imperfect perforase perforases perforase perforásemos perforásedes perforasen

Related terms

[edit]
  • perforación

Further reading

[edit]
  • “perforar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin perforō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

perforar

  1. (transitive) to perforate

Conjugation

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin perforāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /peɾfoˈɾaɾ/ [peɾ.foˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: per‧fo‧rar

Verb

[edit]

perforar (first-person singular present perforo, first-person singular preterite perforé, past participle perforado)

  1. (transitive) to puncture, to pierce, to perforate
    Synonym: pinchar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of perforar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive perforar
gerund perforando
past participle masculine feminine
singular perforado perforada
plural perforados perforadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present perforo perforastú
perforásvos 		perfora perforamos perforáis perforan
imperfect perforaba perforabas perforaba perforábamos perforabais perforaban
preterite perforé perforaste perforó perforamos perforasteis perforaron
future perforaré perforarás perforará perforaremos perforaréis perforarán
conditional perforaría perforarías perforaría perforaríamos perforaríais perforarían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present perfore perforestú
perforésvos2 		perfore perforemos perforéis perforen

(ra) 		perforara perforaras perforara perforáramos perforarais perforaran

(se) 		perforase perforases perforase perforásemos perforaseis perforasen
future1 perforare perforares perforare perforáremos perforareis perforaren

vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative perforatú
perforávos 		perfore perforemos perforad perforen
negative no perfores no perfore no perforemos no perforéis no perforen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
